title: On Bhai Dooj, Twitter Floods With Memes And Jokes About Challenges Of Growing Up With Siblings

On Bhai Dooj, Twitter Floods With Memes And Jokes About Challenges Of Growing Up With Siblings

Diwali is a festival of lights and is celebrated with a lot of fervor. The most exciting part about this five-day festival is that we get to spend time with our families, and anyone who works in a different city will tell you what a privilege that is.

The five days are as follows - Dhanteras, Choti Diwali, Diwali, Govardhan and Bhai Dooj. The festival of Bhai Dooj celebrates the bond between siblings, and we don't need to tell you how special that bond is.

Bhai Dooj is a festival which is celebrated among Hindus of India, Nepal and other countries on the second lunar day of the Shukla Paksha. According to one legend, Lord Krishna visited his sister, Subhadra after killing demon Narkasur. Her sister gave a warm welcome to him and made the occasion really special through flowers and sweets. Subhadra also applied the ceremonial "tilak" on the forehead of her brother, Krishna and hence the festival of "Bhai Dooj" was born from there.

There are a lot more mythological stories based on the origin of Bhai Dooj. No matter, how many stories are there the only thing is that the festival is all about sibling love.

They might irritate you, fight with you and not obey you, but they are the purest form of love! They might mock you, but they will never judge you, and will always have your back in whatever you do. That ways siblings are the best!
